title: Penelope Cruz is lustrous in metallic gown at Wasp Network's New York Film Festival premiere
text:
She arrived at the festival on Friday to do a press conference for her new Cuban spy film, Wasp Network.

And Saturday was the big day of the film's New York Film Festival premiere.

Penelope Cruz, 45, stunned as she walked the carpet in a lustrous strapless gown.

Shine bright! Penelope Cruz, 45, stunned as she walked the carpet for the New York Film Festival premiere of her film Wasp Network on Saturday

Her floor-length black gown featured a gold and silver metallic applique and a hint of subtle black lace at the décolletage.

The Oscar winning actress carried a small golden clutch, accessorizing with gold hoop earrings.

Cruz wore her sleek raven tresses down straight with a middle part that framed her face.

She let her dress do the talking as she kept her makeup more simple with a classic brown smoky eye and an natural shade of lipstick.

Black and gold: Penélope's floor-length black gown featured a gold and silver metallic applique and a hint of subtle black lace at the décolletage

Golden girl: The Oscar winning actress carried a small golden clutch, accessorizing with gold hoop earrings

Cruz was joined on the carpet by her Wasp Network co-star Édgar Ramírez, 42.

Ramírez looked sharp in a grey linen suit with a black t-shirt and matching black boots.

During Friday's press conference, Cruz spoke about working with the younger cast members on the film.

'I love [babies] so once they get to the set, they're mine,' Cruz said, then mimicking her attitude on set, '"I'm gonna be your mommy for a while.'

Co-star: Cruz was joined on the carpet by her Wasp Network co-star Édgar Ramírez, 42

'In the beginning they are like "It's just too intense" but then they get very friendly,' she added.

Speaking of the 1-year-old child she worked with on Wasp Network, Cruz said 'something magical,' happened with the actress where she understood how to play the role right away.

'The day that I shot the end of the movie—the scene where's she's "Momma momma" kissing me—is the day I met her,' she explained.

Wasp Network tells the true story of the Cuban Five, a group of Cuban anti-terrorism intelligence officers who were arrested in the U.S. in September of 1998 and convicted of a string of serious crimes.

Set mom: During the press conference, the Vanilla sky star spoke about working with the younger cast members on the film

The men were part of La Red Avispa, which translates to the Wasp Network, where the film gets its name.

Following their jailing in Miami, Florida, they were charged with conspiracy to commit espionage, conspiracy to commit murder, acting as an agent of a foreign government, among other illegal activities.

The group was in America to infiltrate a number of anti-Cuban terrorist groups and were hailed as heroes back home in Cuba as concerns about the fairness of their trial received international attention.

The Cuban government finally admitted the five men were intelligence agents in 2001 after three years of denying it.

The Cuban Five's attempts to have their convictions overturned ultimately proved fruitless, though they have now been released after serving their time.

Cruz plays Olga Salanueva in the film, the wife of one of the Cuban Five, René González.
